_[toxcore/tox_connection.h, line 121 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18#-KOfeTK44AZKfEuCLI6H:-KOfeTK5qxuKcyYkOD7b:b-ls0p34) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/350b2f8820629ac77a36fef967be0ad1d1a4e73f/toxcore/tox_connection.h#L121)):_

> ``` objc
>  * return -1 on failure.
>  */
> int gettox_conn_id_pk(Tox_Connections *tox_conns, const uint8_t *real_pk);
> ```

any reason not to name this `get_tox_conn_id_pk`? would fit to the rest better.

>  */
> int toxconn_add_tcp_relay(Tox_Connections *tox_conns, int toxconn_id, IP_Port ip_port, const uint8_t *public_key);
> ```

`tox_conn_add_tcp_relay` ?

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions. --- _[toxcore/tox_connection.h, line 113 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18#-KOffWqwuunF9kd-1yJg:-KOfg9h_xoSHKifSJCgC:bb73xfv) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/350b2f8820629ac77a36fef967be0ad1d1a4e73f/toxcore/tox_connection.h#L113)):_
Previously, sudden6 wrote… > `tox_conn_request_object` ? >
> Same --- _[toxcore/tox_connection.h, line 121 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18#-KOfeTK44AZKfEuCLI6H:-KOffQBnL9LnIu8YTCXx:bebz5do) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/350b2f8820629ac77a36fef967be0ad1d1a4e73f/toxcore/tox_connection.h#L121)):_
Previously, sudden6 wrote… > any reason not to name this `get_tox_conn_id_pk`? would fit to the rest better. >
> This is fixed in my next PR, I decided half way through the refactor to stick to the toxconn naming patern. --- _[toxcore/tox_connection.h, line 152 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18#-KOff2gER8v1uP8QeXLJ:-KOffjzJ5JaL5wEIGAQM:bpsonws) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/350b2f8820629ac77a36fef967be0ad1d1a4e73f/toxcore/tox_connection.h#L152)):_
Previously, sudden6 wrote… > `tox_conn_add_tcp_relay` ? >
> No, per jfreegman's suggestion, i'm strictly avoiding the ^tox_ function naming to avoid clobbering the API namespace --- _[toxcore/tox_connection.h, line 202 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18#-KOffL6KVtarQuOeZIbZ:-KOfg39pRpyFdeUJ2w0G:b-34vmyd) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/350b2f8820629ac77a36fef967be0ad1d1a4e73f/toxcore/tox_connection.h#L202)):_
Previously, sudden6 wrote… > `tox_conn_request_callback` ? >
> See above --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18)_
the renaming could use a little more consistency, I'd suggest `tox_conn` everywhere instead of `tox_connection` and ` `tox_conn` mixed.

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 5 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

_[toxcore/friend_requests.c, line 143 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18#-KPGOiFmS7l43Bo6CGj1:-KPGOiFmS7l43Bo6CGj2:bh03lon) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/350b2f8820629ac77a36fef967be0ad1d1a4e73f/toxcore/friend_requests.c#L143)):_

> ``` C
> void friendreq_init(Friend_Requests *fr, Tox_Connections *fr_c)
> {
>     set_tox_conn_request_callback(fr_c, &friendreq_handlepacket, fr);
> ```

I understand what Friend Request is, it's when someone requests us to be their friend, but what Tox Connection Request is supposed to mean? I think it has a very different meaning. Tox Connection Request would mean that someone wants to connect to us, which should happen every single time we connect to someone, which is completely different from friend requests. Shouldn't that be `tox_conn_friend_request_callback`?

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/18)_

commit.message:
Strip the idea of friends from tox_connections.* 2/2

moved:    friend_connection.* -> tox_connection.*

Also stripped the idea of friends from these files.

Still TODO:
* Remove the idea of friends from the onion, and DHT.
* Write a Friend wrapper for Messenger.c to abstract tox_connection from messenger.c

title: Bulk rename friend_connection -> tox_connection
